page.title: 02PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: The land chosen for development was the original site of the National School, the Town yard,housing the Fire Station, the Abattoir and terraced houses for local mill-workers. Due to the increase in population the following amenities are needed;A Sports and Leisure Centre, Community/Social facilities,eg.A Hall; Offices,Residential Hotel,Car Parks, Department Stores,Restaurants,Car Show- Rooms,Single Unit Shops and some Houses This is the most important development on a large scale, to take place in the Town for many years,great care is being taken on the design of the buildings, and the surrounding landscaping of the Area. It is hoped to complement the existing Main Shopping Street of the Chorley, which is dominated at the North end by St. Mary's R.C. Church, and the Town Hall opposite the new Royal Oak Shopping Development.
